content.raw: I made some small comments, otherwise it looks fine, since I don't have a Linux machine yet I won't be able to test it (no iptables).

content.raw:
Consider using a with statement here, that will ensure the file is closed, even if an exception occurs.


```
#!Python

with open(self.logfile, 'a') as f:
    ...
```
content.html:
Consider using a with statement here, that will ensure the file is closed, even if an exception occurs.

with open(self.logfile, 'a') as f:
    ...

content.raw: If the output is -1 or not what you expect then you will get a attribute error or a key error.
content.html: If the output is -1 or not what you expect then you will get a attribute error or a key error.

content.raw: The return of this function is not being checked anywhere, this could lead to odd behavior, like the first of a pair of commands failing, but the second is run even thought he first failed. Perhaps you should just raise if this occurs, and have try/catch/finally statements higher up to recover.
content.html: The return of this function is not being checked anywhere, this could lead to odd behavior, like the first of a pair of commands failing, but the second is run even thought he first failed. Perhaps you should just raise if this occurs, and have try/catch/finally statements higher up to recover.

content.raw: This does not use self, it could be a free function.
content.html: This does not use self, it could be a free function.

content.raw: In this case the else block is dead code, should REPLACELOG be exposed as a public member variable or a parameter to the constructor.
content.html: In this case the else block is dead code, should REPLACELOG be exposed as a public member variable or a parameter to the constructor.

content.raw: There are some minor PEP8 problems related to white space and line length.  I don't know what the policy is on style, the only reason I notice is that my editor complains when it is not PEP8.
